ResourceHeader.ResourceName: SHINE CAMPAIGN EVENTS, Quick Look Table
ResourceHeader.Description: 'Campaign' refers to a concerted, focused effort on one or more event periods or topics, usually taking place over a limited time period with the goal of a final report or papers devoted to the results of the campaign. Since coronal mass ejections (CMEs) are the primary transient phenomena that cause the largest interplanetary disturbances, driving shock waves that in turn accelerate particles and cause the largest geomagnetic storms, it was decided that the SHINE Campaigns should focus on a few carefully selected CME Events  occurring since 1996. The chosen events should have reasonably complete data on both its solar source regions and its propagation through the low corona into the heliosphere. It is desirable but not essential to include Earth-directed events so that their in-situ and geoeffective characteristics can be studied.

Parameter.Name: No
Parameter.Description: Superposition of GOES proton flux, CME height-time plots, GOES X-ray plots for each event.

Parameter.Name: SEP Date
Parameter.Description: Click to access various data sources directly.

Parameter.Name: Width Degrees
Parameter.Description: The width of the CME from LASCO

Parameter.Name: Region and Location
Parameter.Description: NOAA region number and the flares heliographic position

Parameter.Name: Class and Onset Time
Parameter.Description: GOES X-ray class and start time.

Parameter.Name: SEC Events and SRS
Parameter.Description: NOAA SEC Event List and the Solar Region Summary.

Parameter.Name: Daily Movies
Parameter.Description: Daily MPEG movies from LASCO, EIT 19.5 nm, and Yohkoh/SXT.

Parameter.Name: Event Movies
Parameter.Description: Movies from LASCO, EIT 19.5 nm, and TRACE. RD = running difference. LASCO, TRACE1, and TRACE2 movies were created by M. Andrews, D. Alexander, and N. Nitta, respectively.

Parameter.Name: Radio
Parameter.Description: WIND/WAVES high- and low-resolution and Culgoora spectrograms. The HiRAS plots are high frequency (>20 MHz) spectra mostly from Hiraiso and WIND/RAD 2.

Parameter.Name: Protons/Ions
Parameter.Description: GOES and ACE data were provided by their websites. Wind/LEMT data were contributed by D.V. Reames. Plots from Tylka et al. (2004, submitted to ApJ).

Parameter.Name: Solar Wind
Parameter.Description: Wind/SWE data from NSSDC, courtesy of K. Ogilvie.

Parameter.Name: Notes
Parameter.Description: View and/or edit the comments files.
